intro: Anil lyallii, commonly known as the lyall's anil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Pakistan and northern India. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it blooms during the summer months. Anil lyallii is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
